------=_Part_5212922_1221802961.1446119345242
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello, David.

Yes, you're right, there are plenty materials; however, the =
quality is not always very good. I haven't discovered any consistent summar=
izing set of basic rules (or introduction) for beginners. Also I have chose=
n the topic to be my bachelor's thesis so I am going to write this kind of =
text anyway, and thought it might be useful for you as well.

For you my wo=
rk can be an experiment which is not going to cost you a thing, and if you =
like it you can use it without any further adjustments as a part of JUnit w=
ikihelp. I would also like to create the materials from the very beginning =
so that they are consistent with the official formats JUnit uses (so that t=
he users can see the connection with JUnit straight away).
That is why I wo=
uld appreciate to use the formats and tools that JUnit team uses. Would you=
 mind giving me some hints as to what tools would be the most suitable?

It=
 will not be ready very soon; the earliest in March 2016, I suppose.
Regard=
sTereza 


     On Friday, October 16, 2015 5:10 PM, "David Saff saff@googl=
e.com [junit]" <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
   

 =C2=A0   Tereza,
Thanks=
 for your mail!=C2=A0 The tutorial you linked to is definitely on the short=
er side.=C2=A0 However, searching for "JUnit tutorials" does provide a numb=
er of write-ups of varying lengths and quality.=C2=A0 Before you devote a l=
ot of time to writing your own, I wonder if you think that perhaps one of t=
hose would be a good thing to link to as a supplement to what's on the gith=
ub site?
Thanks,
=C2=A0 =C2=A0David=C2=A0
On Fri, Oct 16, 2015 at 2:26 AM, =
jana novakova qwiriella@... [junit] <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

 =
=C2=A0   Dear Sir/Madam,
I am writing to you regarding JUnit tests tutorial=
s. I am currently studying informatics at University of West Bohemia in Pil=
sen, and while browsing=C2=A0https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Getti=
ng-started=C2=A0I discovered that very basic instructions on how to start u=
sing JUnit tests are quite brief. My supervisor has some tutorials for begi=
nners; however, they are in Czech - not very useful for the rest of the wor=
ld. I was thinking of perharps filling in this gap - I probably would be ab=
le to prepare a consistent introduction based on materials provided.=C2=A0C=
ould it be useful for you? If so, I would appreciate some starting tips (su=
itable/recommended tools for writing, formating standards etc.)

RegardsTer=
eza S.

      <div></div>=
<div dir=3D"ltr">Tereza,<div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>Thanks for your =
mail!  The tutorial you linked to is definitely on the shorter side.&n=
bsp; However, searching for "JUnit tutorials" does provide a number of writ=
e-ups of varying lengths and quality.  Before you devote a lot of time=
 to writing your own, I wonder if you think that perhaps one of those would=
 be a good thing to link to as a supplement to what's on the github site?</=
div><div><br clear=3D"none"></div><div>Thanks,</div><div><br clear=3D"none"=
></div><div>   David </div></div><div class=3D"yiv4597571120=

an></div><div style=3D"color:rgb(34,34,34);font-family:arial, sans-serif;fo=
nt-size:12.8px;"><br clear=3D"none"><div>I am writing to you regarding JUni=
t tests tutorials. I am currently studying informatics at University of Wes=
t Bohemia in Pilsen, and while browsing <a rel=3D"nofollow" shape=3D"r=
ect" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Get=
ting-started" style=3D"color:rgb(17,85,204);font-size:12.8px;">https://gith=
ub.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Getting-started</a> I discovered that ver=
y basic instructions on how to start using JUnit tests are quite brief. My =
supervisor has some tutorials for beginners; however, they are in Czech - n=
ot very useful for the rest of the world. I was thinking of perharps fillin=
g in this gap - I probably would be able to prepare a consistent introducti=
on based on materials provided. </div><div>Could it be useful for you?=
 If so, I would appreciate some starting tips (suitable/recommended tools f=
or writing, formating standards etc.)</div></div><div style=3D"color:rgb(34=
,34,34);font-family:arial, sans-serif;font-size:12.8px;"><br clear=3D"none"=
></div><div style=3D"color:rgb(34,34,34);font-family:arial, sans-serif;font=

ont-family:arial, sans-serif;font-size:12.8px;"><div>Regards</div><div dir=
=3D"ltr">Tereza S.</div></div></div><div></div>
